page.title: 01INTRODUCTION (LAMPHEY)
page.content: Lamphey is a country area.There are three villages,Lamphey,the largest, Freshwater East,a seaside village,and the small hamlet of Hodgeston.There are two farms and a cottage at Lake. There are fifteen farms on gentle hills and wooded valleys.Most of the people who live in the villages work outside the area.Most of the old people live in council houses.The area is very busy in summer with tourists visiting Lamphey Palace and Freshwater East Beach.Lamphey has a railway halt, a bus service from Pembroke to Fresh water East,Hodgeston and Tenby.There are churches in Lamphey and Hodgeston. Lamphey has a village shop,petrol station and post office all in one building.Freshwater East has similar facilities.There are two public houses in Freshwater East and one in Lamphey. Lamphey is the centre for activities.
